title: IT Student Support Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was regarding an implementation of a new project whose starting point was a project I had mentioned in my resume. The project I mentioned was about developing a 3-tier client/server application which replicated an online shopping model. The project my employer had in mind was to write a client program in Linux which upon given an HTML link would ping the server and seek out HTML page which was to be stored and parsed to mine a specific content.
Interview Questions: How did you implement a 3-tier client/server architecture?

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (University Park, MD) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Emailed questionnaire followed by 30 min in person. Then you are asked about your resume and the projects or work experience you have listed on there. The interview is about 30 min and its behavioral questions.  It is pretty straightforward and laid back
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you failed at something?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Screening call, then in-person interview, then call to negotiate offer. Pretty basic process and questions. I did basic prep, customized some of my canned answers to the position and everythign was fine.  There wasn't much room for them to negotiate on salary as levels are prescribed by the state.
Interview Questions: Pretty basic questions - focused on program management

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an application via southcampuscommons.com and waited about 3 months for a call back for an interview. My interview was short, but it was because they needed to hire someone asap. I met the qualifications and my school scheduled seemed workable with the coverage they needed.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Physical Edication Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Maryland in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was easy, people are really nice. I was welcomed into the program. We got along well. Thank you. Can’t wait to see you all soon! Very excited to start my new job
Interview Questions: They asked about me a lot.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with multiple interviewers.  Started as a Skype interview but their connection kept dropping.  Interviewers were very nice and had interesting things to say in response to my questions.
Interview Questions: Some programming, mostly behavioral.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: brief interview at Xfinity, very fun with a lot of joke questions.  More about getting to know the person rather than the candidate.  Asked what state i would get rid of, wwe theme song, etc
Interview Questions: If you were a WWE wrestler what would be your walk out song?

title: REU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: I sent in an application with 2 letters of recommendation from professors, my transcripts, and a statement of interest in January. They got back to me with an offer in March, and I had until April to accept it.
Interview Questions: An interview was not part of the process.

title: Ph D Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: Applied online first. If you are qualified you will be enrolled as a Ph.D student. The first year is rotation without an adviser. You have to talk to the professors and know whether they have funding and what they are doing. The professor also asks your research backgound to see whether you fit in his / her lab
Interview Questions: What's your previous research background?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: easy most professors just talk to you about their research and you can get a clear picture of how happy graduate students are. You are given plenty of time to prepare for who you are scheduled to speak with. The schedule and organization of the interview is very well organized.
Interview Questions: tell me about your research

title: IT Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied for the job through their online platform. I was called regarding the position and scheduled for a phone interview. After the phone interview I was invited for an in person interview, where I had to give a presentation and then answer questions from a panel. I then had a written quiz of sorts and a one on one interview with the Assistant Director.
Interview Questions: What is W3C School?

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: 6 on 1 interview. Everyone was very friendly but very quiet. They all sat on one side of the table and took notes while asking me questions from technical to ethical.
Interview Questions: How do you tell your supervisor when they are wrong?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: Had an in-person interview with the investigator. Gave a presentation and met with the members of the lab. This was after recommendation was provided by my then supervisor. Overall very good experience.
Interview Questions: Describe your work

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: Took the GREs. Had interned in a lab for several years during undergraduate studies. Had already developed a relationship developed with the professor. Exposure to my lab ahead of time really help in the application process.
Interview Questions: Behavioral. Minor technical.

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple and easy because they ask basic stuffs, and they just hire who had interviews. Also, they hired other college students. They have the shortage of workers, so they hire a lot of students.
Interview Questions: name, background, major

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university's job posting website. My would-be supervisor contacted me about an interview. We arranged it. I sat down with the supervisor and office assistant. I was asked some questions regarding my skills and experience. They reacted positively to my answers and offered me the job the following day.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in film editing?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: One-on-one conversation with the Principle Investigator, took about 45 minutes or an hour. After the interview I was given an offer after a couple of weeks (2 or 3?) but could not start the position until ~4 months as it took time to process my visa. I think otherwise it could have been maybe 6 weeks or less between the interview and start date.
Interview Questions: Why did I want the job (it was a bit different from my training), did I have any examples of my work, what do I like about it, how do I feel about writing for lay outlets and for academic journals..

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted my application, it was about a month and a half before receiving an email asking to schedule an interview. The interview was very simple and the interviewer told me immediately afterwards that I got the job. It was very un-formal and he was friendly and clarified a question if I answered incorrectly.
Interview Questions: What personal projects (outside of school) have you done related to this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: She has a talk with me, asks my background, what I have done before, why I choose this group, why I choose her,  my interest and my future career goal.
Interview Questions: How long can you work in one week?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: This interview was very straight forward. It was behavioral and there were multiple people in the interview. 25 minutes long. They asked standard questions. I received the job on the spot. I suggest that if you're looking for an on campus job you should apply within the first two weeks of the start of school. Spots fill up fast
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you didn't see eye to eye with someone you were working with.

title: Program Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online through the UMD jobs website. I was contacted by phone and asked to submit a resume and cover letter and come in for an in-person interview a few days later. After the in-person interview, I waited a few days while they contacted my references and then I started a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: What is one thing that makes you a unique hire for this position?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with basic screening questions. Salary range, resume review etc.  Two in person interviews. 
Four person panel interview. 
One on One with program director.
The process is much easier if you know someone who is already at the university. Overall pretty easy and very straight forward.
Interview Questions:
Typical interview questions. 
-Why are you good fit?
-Here is the Role...how does your skill set match. etc

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Maryland in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit my resume through my college website. Received a call within a week. Interview consisted of an excel test of 30 minuted and then general questions for about another 30 minutes. overall a great experience. interviewers were really good and accommodating
Interview Questions:
what are your future plans?
what are your expectations?
how did you prepare for this?
past experience?
any certifications?

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly simple process, fill out the online forms, and then they set up either an in person or online interview. During interview just to be sure to highlight customer service experience or anything that would qualify you for working every day with students and faculty at the university.
Interview Questions: mainly about customer services scenarios, Attention to detail, the importance of diversity and professionalism while working and the overall ability to provide excellent customer service while also remaining friendly and stern with residents

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Maryland in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an informal meeting with the associate dean of engineering and he did not ask too many questions.I had gone through a different interview with the office of student affairs prior to meeting him.
Interview Questions: Just general questions about my past work experiences and studies

title: Desk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a easy interview process not much questions, mainly they check for communication skills and ability to understand client. My overall behavior and appeal was checked to ensure that they found the right guy
Interview Questions: They asked me what would be the first thing I would do if a client had any problems

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The position I interviewed did not ask a lot of questions. Just Basic questions. Some technical positions may ask questions regarding your qualifications as mentioned on resume. Getting part-time job on campus is quiet easy as long as you know where the position is available.
Interview Questions: Any previous job experience at University?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Maryland (University Park, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Easy, casual. Consisted of interest through e-mails back and forth between potential employer. I did not need to include my resume, I basically wrote a letter of interest and so it was entirely easy of a process. The experience was great
Interview Questions: Previous research, interests, potential research options

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD)
Interview Descriptions: The Interview Process was not conducted as a regular interview that I am normally given. They called me and I came in and later that day, I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in five years.

title: Faculty Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: I saw that there was a job search online and through a friend, I turned my resume in and then was called in for an interview. After the interview I was contacted within a week with an offer. The interview was relatively short, was it was nerve wracking because I had to know details about the lab and the work they were doing there.
Interview Questions: They asked what my goals were for my research and my career.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Typical academic on-campus interview with job talk, meetings with search committee, faculty, department chair, and graduate students. Everyone had clearly reviewed my materials ahead of time, asked relevant questions, and was very friendly.They took me to breakfast and lunch and made sure I was comfortable throughout the day. Unlike other university searches, they scheduled a campus visit without a preliminary phone or skype interview.
Interview Questions: What is your five-year plan? What are your strategies for supporting student diversity?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
about less than 30 min
 small talk in the beginning 
describes what you would be doing 
ask if you have experience dealing with pears 
how was I successful in this class 
class I wasn't successful in and how i tried to bounce back
Interview Questions:
Why do you want this job 
how would you deal with a student who doesn't attend mandatory tutoring

title: Network Operation Center Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was based on basic it-networking principals. Revise basic networking principals, OSI Model , have some Cisco certification before applying. They use a variety of products and technologies but read about only few in details to increase the chances . Also one shall have basic knowledge of the hardware like ups , access points, batteries and if possible voip phones.
Interview Questions: Explain in brief about OSI Model.

title: Teaching Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: For the Chemistry Dept, they have a panel to interview you. This consists of 5-8 people interviewing and asking you questions about things you should be knowledgeable about. The questions were typical to the chemistry field but the panel can sometimes feel intimidating. Afterwards you realize all the people are actually pretty nice.
Interview Questions: How well do you deal with pressure?

title: Data Collection Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview was fair, the supervisor just told me to setup a circuit for a testing device and then connect the device with the computer software and get some data from it. After all it was bad, really easy to get the job, however, the supervisor never show after the interview
Interview Questions: setup a circuit and connect it to the computer

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and fairly straight forward. Submit an application to the Professor stating your desire to be TA of the course. Usually its 1-to-1 inperson interview with the professor. Once you get TAship, payroll adds you in the department quickly
Interview Questions: Describe your past experience and skill set related to this course

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called me on the phone and offered me the job without a interview. Mostly he talked about what roles I would be expected to do in the lab and asked if I was ok with those responsibilities.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: Summer internship at the CATT Lab at UMD. Applied through Careers4Terps. One technical interview onsite. Various language options made available for the problem. Given an hour to complete the task.
Interview Questions: Implement a linked list in C.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: Went to supervisor's office. There was construction so I couldn't go through the main entrance. Very sweet lady. She talked the entire time about the job and the environment. She told me how impressive my resume was. I just asked about specific duties and schedules.
Interview Questions: What times are you available during the day?

title: Security Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a one on one interview. And they asked pretty simple questions. Nothing Fancy.Basic HR questions i believe. There will be two people taking the interview. Answer the questions well and you most certainly will have the job
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: phone interview and in person interview with a few people from department... i was contacted by HR within a few weeks of applying and then told I passed the phone interview and the lab manager contacted me and I had an interview with members of the lab, PI and department
Interview Questions: Interview questions revolved around experience

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were a few essays asking for why you wanted to be an RA and what skills do you think are necessary for the job. Then there was a individual interview, followed by a group interview if you passed the individual interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Talk with the professor who leads the lab you want to go. The professor will give you an introduction of the lab and see if you are passionate about the research work.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply for this work?

title: Addiction COunselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at University of Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very nice and smooth. The interviewee was fair with questions that were asked.. most questions about the position were simply straight forward and anyone could answer.
Interview Questions: What school did I attended

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a skype interview with two professors from the department. They asked some questions about the GRE score and the reason I am interested in their group. I told them I know the group from a previous group member. They also asked me if how was my dissertation going on.
Interview Questions: How did you know our group?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Apply to the Graduate School by the application deadline provining all required documents.
Do not try to reach out to random faculty members if you do not have previous interaction.
Highlight the research experience in your CV and statement of purpose.
Interview Questions: If you get a phone interview they might ask you some details of the research experience you have. And in general test your communication skills if you are not a native speaker.

title: Clinical Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: Great people during interview. They wanted to be sure about my experience, which was of the greatest concerns to them. I asked why and they answered that they had some inexperienced staff in the past and were concerned about regulatory compliance. They were pretty much were cool after that. Generic questions mostly.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions.

title: REC WELL Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sit down with current supervisors as well as their supervisors, and simply answer questions about yourself and the job. Present a powerpoint relevant to your job. Feels very casual. Sit down with current supervisors as well as their supervisors, and simply answer questions about yourself and the job. Present a powerpoint relevant to your job. Feels very casual
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview for position with whole department in 3 separate interviews in one day. My expectations and future projects were discussed and outside interest were discussed as well. Overall, it was a very calm and easy-going interview. I recommend working at UMD!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UMD?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions:
Applied by mailing the CATT Lab's person in charge of hiring. Got a mail reply a few months after applying.
First round was telephonic and mainly centered around previous projects, communication skills and cultural fit. It was easy.
Second round was a make or break test. It was a PHP/Javascript/HTML project which I had to understand and then find and fix all possible bugs. The catch was the time frame - it needed to be done in an hour.
Interview Questions: There were no other questions - the time frame was challenging.

title: Admissions Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews, one via Skype and another via in-person panel. Skype was interview with two people from the office that lasted about 30 minutes. In-person panel consisted of three groups of people that lasted over two hours cumulatively. Process was relatively quick from initial contact for Skype interview to notification of second round of interviewing. All communication ceased after in-person interview, even after a couple of failed attempts to follow up.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions asking about previous experience and interest in the job. Nothing really unexpected.

title: Associate Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are conducted in a fair manner. The university is an equal opportunity employer. Search committees are well trained in appropriate interview procedures. For example, candidates are asked the same list of questions, are vetted in terms of their ability to illustrate claims about knowledge, skills, and abilities with concrete specific examples, and are evaluated in terms of their ability to work in an interdisciplinary, innovative, team environment. Candidates for research scientist positions are expected to give a job talk about their research. Candidates are broadly vetted by the various types of employees in a department or center. An online system, makes submission of interview materials very convenient. The interview process is transparent and candidates are encouraged to ask any questions they may have at any time during the process.
Interview Questions: A member of your research team does not agree with your scientific-technical judgment in your role as a principal investigator about the appropriate way to analyze the data. How do you manage the disagreement? Please try to illustrate this with an example based on your past experience.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very disorganized. Multiple phone calls taken during process. Conflicting instructions between two interviewers. Never given result of interview even after reaching out and requesting. Made it clear I was awaiting their answer before I applied elsewhere.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions: I was grandfathered in with a research group here i have had contact and collaborations with.  I did not go through any formal interview process as i had been working here for quite some time as a graduate student before i accepted the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior IT Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland
Interview Descriptions:
The normal interview process got simpler.  It took months before call candidates for an interview because delay forming a search committee members. Now, upper manager can interview directly and will last only 2-3 steps. After resume review, qualifying candidates will receive a phone interview. Then, on-site interview will be available for possible candidates (around 4-5 candidate). Finally, top 3 choices will be presented to the department coordinator.

Overall UMD interview is not as difficult as any other private companies.  UMD looks for a candidate with multiple talents with a minimum salary. However, UMD is a very good place to beginning of career.
Interview Questions: I don't recall receiving any difficult nor unexpected questions.  UMD policy does not allow us to generate any creative interview questions. Most questions are what you find online.

title: Oiep Program Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got interviewed by 4 people. One of them is your supervisor, another is your fellow co-worker, your boss and another guy. they will interview you in a small classroom and all you need to do is talking. Questions are simple. It's quite casual an interview.
Interview Questions: Why tutor, why OIEP, obstacles that you've overcame, punctuality, career goal, length you can stay.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application, with resume, cover letter, and 3 references. It is up to the the person hiring to reach out to the students, whether that be through email or phone.  There was a follow up interview and a Phone call for acceptance.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness.

title: Terp Host Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
very smooth quick process, they start with a series of questions to assess your knowledge, abilities and personal suitability. These may include:
•Closed questions that demonstrate your knowledge by requiring a specific factual answer. 
•Open-ended questions that are broader in scope and require you to work through the answer. 
•Situational questions that describe a hypothetical situation and ask how you would proceed in those circumstances. 
•Behavioural questions that ask you to describe a time in your own history when you dealt with a certain situation, and to explain how you dealt with it.
Interview Questions: why do you want to be a terp host?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initially email a faculty for the position. They do advertise them. Apply to Grad School too. Skype interview and telephonic interview. Email for selection from faculty, departmental coordinator and then grad school.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview

title: Program Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process for non-exempt employees usually has 3 or four rounds of pool reduction.  All resumes are submitted to the University HR department and those are sent to the search committee for further review.  The search committee receives the charge from the hiring official as to what key skills/experience they are looking for in a candidate and it is the responsibility of the search committee to reduce the pool of candidates to a handful of diverse (race/gender) very capable people.  The committee then makes its recommendation to the hiring official.  The search committee might have a telephone interview, and then a face-to-face interview before making its final determination.  After that, the hiring official meets with the handful of candidates to make a hiring decision. 

The search committee is made up of people who will be working with the candidate, an hr representative, and other people that might be indirectly in contact with that position.  Search committee also represents the diversity of the UMD workplace both in terms of race/gender and also in the organization hierarchy.
Interview Questions: What experience have you had with Integrated Work Place Management systems at a university setting or a similar institution and tell us the most technically complex relevant environment where you have worked in the last five years.

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
The first stage is to check at the universities job website and fill/submit an online application. 99% of the application requires a Resume, Cover letter and Reference so always have it handy.

If your skill set matches the needs of the job, a search committee comprising of 2 to 5 people may give you an phone or  face-to-face screening interview. Of course the candidate will be notified before the interview date. It takes an average of 4 weeks to get to interview with the search committee.

If you qualify, the search committee will submit your name to the hiring manager who will then schedule a final face to face interview with the candidate. It takes and average of 4 weeks to get an interview with the hiring manager and another 2 weeks to get the result.

The result usually comes with an offer/rejection letter. It takes an average of 3 weeks before getting this letter.

In all the recruitment process takes about 3 months to finalize.
Interview Questions: Tell me about University of Maryland. As easy as it sounds, there are a lot of things to talk about. You are not sure of which to say.

title: IT Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: The first step is to apply via the online website regardless of where you see the job posting. After that depends on the hiring committee - which is formed of several potential peers and a manager. In my case they called for a quick phone interview before inviting me to an interview in front of the entire committee and asked questions round robin. Afterwards I had one final interview with the hiring manager and was offered the job on the spot. Having further served on a committee myself the way it works behind the scenes is that a committee is formed as soon as the job is posted and they select and reject resumes based on the hiring manager's criteria. They also choose who to send to the hiring manager, who then makes the final decision. Great effort is made to make the committee as diverse as possible in culture, gender, ethnicity and job position so as to avoid discriminatory hiring practices.

title: Faculty Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (Washington, DC) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty simple. They asked questions about my prior experience, whether I was good with customer service, why I wanted to be there, my education, my future plans etc.
Interview Questions: The interview was pretty simple. They asked questions about my prior experience, whether I was good with customer service, why I wanted to be there, my education, my future plans etc.

title: Research Associate Interview

title: IT Student Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Phone call to plan walk in interview. Asked me about my relevant experience, a few semi-technical questions. Then I spoke with an employee in charge of payroll and they asked me for some financial information. I received an offer that day and accepted! It was an overall painless process and they could definitely tell I was nervous and worked with me every step of the way.
Interview Questions: What do you know about technology?

title: Student Programmer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Oct 2011

title: Facilities Project Manager Interview

Interview Questions: Why did you apply because your resume does not spell out that you are a Facilities process manager

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Online application, very very easy. Typical for a transportation department to do this. I just had to show up and interview. I was offered the position on the spot, before leaving the building.
Interview Questions: What would you do in an emergency situation?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Apply online to the school website. On getting selected generally in one interview you can get the results.
Technical jobs require knowledge and technical test. For administrative jobs aptitude and presentation skills are important.
Interview Questions: Would you like to work from home or office?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy going interview, I think by the time they offer you an interview, you're pretty much in.
Interview Questions: What's your greatest weakness?

title: Dining Service Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and easy.  Simply asked what sort of worker you would be, and if you had any experience in the dining services field.  That being said, I applied as an undergraduate for a very clearly undergraduate position.
Interview Questions: Do you have prior work experience in food service?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Got an email and a call from the office assistant letting me know that they wanted to set up an interview.  The office assistant set up a phone panel interview with several people.  They asked a lot of behavioral questions that started with "Describe a situation when..."  and seemed disorganized when they were trying to decide which questions to ask and who should ask them.  They said that they would get back to me by the next week, and they did not.  I called to follow up and received an email in response letting me know that they hired someone.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you dealt with an angry customer?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Even since I get admission to the PhD program, I could talk to the adviser for funding opportunity and he suggested a research assistant for his out-campus project.
Interview Questions: The most important things to co-work with the professor was research interest and relevant experience. I had to have the same research interest with the adviser and skills he needs for the project

title: Math Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: One first applies online. An interview is then granted. The interview is short and easy and conducted by two senior math coaches. They are also students so pressure is low. They did not conduct any personality test.
Interview Questions: They ask you which math classes you have taken, some simple calculus problems to make sure you know what you are doing, and how you would guide a student through a problem.

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The staff that I meet with were very welcoming and professional.  The process was very informative and even laid back.  For your interview presentation, if you can provide examples of how you would address issues in the job, it should be very beneficial.  Also, the arrangements to bring me in for the interview were handled very professionally and made the trip to Baltimore a pleasure.  Go into the interview confident and friendly.  That kind of attitude will go a long way towards proving that you are a good fit for the university.
Interview Questions: To be honest, there were no difficult or unexpected questions that I can recall.  I was well prepared for the interview.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was directly introduced to my current advisor by a mentor who provided a strong recommendation. I was asked to visit the university and my advisor and I was given a tour of the lab space.  I only spoke with my soon to be advisor for about 10 minutes as we walked from the lab to his office. I'm sure he was checking for red flags, but I'm sure I was 90% secured even before visiting.
Interview Questions: What were you working on before?

title: Graduate Assistant, Department of Resident Life Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial application due early in the year (January time frame) with a request for an on campus interview in February. If you couldn't make the on campus interview, you would not be considered. The interview process was a full day experience with several other potential candidates. Each candidate had several one on one interviews with staff members.
Interview Questions: Provide a time when you made a mistake and how you corrected it.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I looked up professor I wanted to work with online, reviewed the work they did in the lab, and went in for interview.  They ask you why you want to work at their lab and your availability.  Most professors will train you in the lab.  The most important aspects are your availability and how long you are planning to stay with the lab
Interview Questions: Do you have any prior lab experience

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The most important aspect of the interview process is to ensure alignment between the adviser's work and student's research interests.  If the student's interests diverge from those of the potential adviser's, it is crucial that the student verify that his or her research goals can be accommodated under the particular professor's mentor-ship and funding scheme.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals in research?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with four people from the department.  Several questions about handling difficult personalities.  Required to make a powerpoint presentation.  Panel interview took about 40 minutes.  Saw the workspace to be used by the hiree (small, cramped, cluttered) in a shared office.  Was given several example documents produced by the department.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult personalities?

title: Management Consultant Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5+ months. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jan 2011

Interview Questions: Do you have entrepreneurial experience?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: contacted me for a phone interview with a panel of on-campus representatives.  asked me about my experience and what i would bring to the position.  said they would get back to me by the end of the week.  two weeks later i called asking if they made a decision either way.  they asked me to come to college park for a personal interview.  i was reimbursed for most of my travel expenses.  had a four hour interview with the director, a panel of campus representatives and some of the staff at the department.  i was informed about a week later that i did not get the position.  overall it was a positive experience although i'm still waiting for my travel expense reimbursement and the hotel they put me up in was a converted motel.
Interview Questions: how would you inform a program manager that participating in a training program was to his/her benefit?

title: Electronic Resources Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Maryland (College Park, MD) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I primarily corresponded with an HR representative, who arranged both my phone and on-campus interview. The phone interview was with 4 people and lasted about 20 minutes, with time for questions afterwards. The on-campus interview lasted a day and included a 15-min. presentation. Everyone that I met was very friendly.
Interview Questions: What makes you mad?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
